summary: This bill, the Tax Excessive CEO Pay Act of 2025, amends the Internal Revenue Code to impose a corporate tax rate increase on companies with high CEO-to-median worker compensation ratios. The increase is a penalty based on a table that correlates the pay ratio to the percentage-point increase in the corporate tax rate. The bill also includes conforming amendments to other sections of the code and specifies an effective date of January 1, 2026. The Secretary of the Treasury is instructed to issue regulations to prevent avoidance of the bill's intent.
